title: College Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy, must be able to stand up and give a presentation in front of a group of five people. Not hard and the space was very welcoming and the people were very nice. Did not feel intimidated at all
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself in five minute presentation

title: Career Advisor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Was referred to job. Interviewed within a week of submitting resume. Interviewed with hiring manager and offer was extended at the end. Lower than industry norm wages. The duties of the job were described and given a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: Name some examples of coaching or developing an employee

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at FIDM in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview is multiple levels but very fair and easy questions to understand.  You must be able to speak publicly and stand up and do at least a three minute introduction of who you are.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a difficult situation you had to overcome?

title: Education Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at FIDM in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: They asked me a lot of basic questions and essentially condescended to me the whole time while not offering any feedback or even basic conversational body language and it was weird and off-putting.
Interview Questions: What were my best classes in school where I showed the most strength?

title: Speakers Bureau Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at FIDM
Interview Descriptions: Created a 15 Minute presentation with PowerPoint on relevant applied arts content and presented to several directors in a public space. Continued with 45 minutes of conversation. It was casual but beginning with a presentation was slightly nerve racking.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have if any in public speaking?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at FIDM
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple. I interviewed with multiple chairs and was asked about my previous job history and what I can contribute to the position. They reviewed the job description with me and gave a sample of day to day tasks that I would have to compete should I get the position.
Interview Questions: How would I deal with time sensitive tasks and "difficult" faculty or students?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Although I did not get the position, overall I think this was one of the best interviews I experienced. The interviewers were very informative and throughly discussed the said position. They had great questions and took the time to get to know me and my past jobs.  I felt less nervous because of this and was able to answer their questions. The school also was easy to communicate with and responded regarding the interviews steps.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for FIDM?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Detailed interview getting to know your qualifications and you as a person. They were at a time of transitioning to a cloud based database and were looking for a more experienced IT specialist to help transfer so I did not make the cut.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with work drama?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process included a prelim phone interview and in-person interview with my future supervisor and another team member I would be working closely with. The interview lasted over an hour, it was very long. The questions were very straightforward, no trick questions.
Interview Questions: How has your job history prepared you for this position?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions. It seems as if the questions were taken off of the internet. They were very mechanical. Standard questions. It seems as if the questions were taken off of the internet. They were very mechanical.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Multimedia Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick, they were straight to the point, didn't ask me any personal questions. Asked me questions about time management as well as my work process. Also they looked at my online portfolio and had me do an animation right then and there to test my animations kills as well as how fast I did my work and how diligent I was. Also they were very interested in my other art backgrounds like fashion and sculpture. They wanted a well rounded person.
Interview Questions: Will you show us some of your work, why do you think it will be helpful to our company?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Depends on the department and what they are looking for.  Also depends on the program and the time of year.  Industry experience is valued and no teaching experience is required.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at FIDM

title: Fertigungsleiter / Sachkundiger Verantwortlicher für Pharmakovigilanz Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Questions: What online marketing initial would you design for FIDM

title: Easy to Get Hired Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at FIDM (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Basically, the turnover is huge here.  They don't pay well, don't offer benefits to many employees and ignore quite a few basic human resources rules.  It's pretty easy to get a job here.  Once you're in they don't have much opportunity for growth--they save those for FIDM grads and for relatives of long time FIDM employees.
Interview Questions: They will be expecting you to be dressed to the nines and will ask you detailed questions about your clothing and shoes.

title: Administrative Assistant  Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at FIDM (South San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2007
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed and selected right away
